Fields.DialogueText: Things can be different now, Kapitän.
What do you mean, U-30?
U-Boote have been used to attack enemy merchant ships in the past, but things are different in this war with the Nixen. U-boats no longer have to attack civilians to support the war effort.
That's certainly true. The Morganas don't have merchant ships, and there's no question that any Morgana out there is a military target - they'll try to destroy any human ship they encounter.
Ja, Kapitän. So I think this war with the Nixen is a chance for U-Boote to repent for their sins of the past. We can protect civilian ships instead of sinking them.

Fields.MenuText: I suppose so. We just follow orders, U-30 - and our orders are to sink Morganas.
You don't have to feel guilty about what U-boats did in the past. You were just commissioned a few years ago.
You sure are hung up on making up for past mistakes, aren't you?

Fields.DialogueText: Ja, Kapitän, but I have already made mistakes...
You don't have to be such a perfectionist, U-30! We all make bad decisions sometimes. The important thing is to learn and do better next time.
Ja... ja, Kapitän! Such wise words from my savior!
I really wish you'd drop that whole "savior" thing.
Of course, Kapitän - and even better if we can protect innocent merchant ships while doing it!
The North Sea hasn't been safe for anyone since the Morganas showed up. Any Morgana we sink will save countless lives.
You really are a savior, Kapitän! Is there any way we can tell HQ that we'd like to do more to protect civilian ships? Perhaps we can escort convoys now that we're not trying to sink them.
I... I have not always done the right thing in life, Kapitän. I must live with this guilt and do my best to redeem myself.
Nobody's perfect, U-30. Don't worry - we'll sink tons of Morganas before this war is over, and every one we take out will save countless lives.
A U-boat pulling convoy escort duty instead of trying to sink merchant ships? Now that's a novel thought...
We U-Boote must atone for our past deeds, Kapitän. Imagine how much good we could do protecting convoys from Morganas! Please mention this to HQ--
*BOOM*
Morganas ahead! I'll tell HQ about your idea, but right now we've got to worry about protecting ourselves!
@BATTLE
It's a little unorthodox, but I spoke with HQ about your idea.
My idea that U-Boote can provide convoy security against the Morganas?
Yes. Frankly, things are extremely disorganized at HQ - we're so short on ships that they don't care what we're doing as long as we're out there sinking Morganas.
Of course, Kapitän. HQ is confused and directionless, as always. Does this mean we can start supporting convoy operations?

Fields.MenuText: I doubt HQ will ever assign a U-boat to protect convoys.
We'll need to find a convoy that needs our help first.
Can't we just patrol for Morganas like we usually do?

Fields.DialogueText: Ja, Kapitän, but think of how much more good it would do if we protected merchant ships at the same time!
Of course, Kapitän - we can hardly rely on HQ to issue productive orders in the first place!
That shouldn't be difficult, Kapitän. Every civilian ship is scared to sail alone because of the Nixen.
Well, the Morganas are sinking tons of civilian ships in the area. The chances are getting slim for a merchant ship to sail anywhere without running into Morganas...
These ships need to be saved, Kapitän - and who better to save them than you, our savior? HQ will continue to do nothing while the Nixen sink every defenseless ship in the Atlantic.
I suppose we could do something...
Ja, Kapitän! Thank you for your approval. I will take a walk around the harbor with Schnuffi. We will assemble a convoy to protect any merchant ship in need of crossing the Atlantic.
Wait, I didn't exactly approve of anything yet! I was just thinking--
*ALARM*
See how bad things are, Kapitän? We already have Nixen in the harbor! We will take care of these Nixen first, then assemble our convoy!
@BATTLE
Just as I suspected, Kapitän!
Were you able to find any civilians in need of convoy protection?
Of course, Kapitän. The Nixen have disrupted civilian traffic across the Atlantic. I have a dozen merchant Kapitäne who urgently need to cross over to Canada and America.
However, the Nixen have been sinking so many merchants trying to cross that all the Kapitäne here are too scared to leave port without an armed escort.
We have tons of shipping running weeks behind schedule. Think about the effect this is having on the war effort!
There's still the land war going on, U-30. Escorting convoys across the Atlantic will benefit other Neutrality Fleet countries more than it'll help Germany. The Kriegsmarine won't like this at all.
We're all part of the Neutrality Fleet against the Morganas, but you're still a U-boat in service of Germany. Like it or not, Berlin's going to weigh in.
But Kapitän - we are fighting to protect innocent lives! I don't care about the politics and misguided ideology from those idiots at HQ! It's done nothing but create one tragedy after another!

Fields.MenuText: I guess escorting merchants across the Atlantic would help the Neutrality Fleet as a whole...
Our crew is small, but we do have submariners from every Neutrality Fleet country on board...
We would sink a ton of Morganas crossing the Atlantic, and everyone would benefit from that...

Fields.DialogueText: Ja, Kapitän! You're always thinking about the big picture, aren't you?
Ja, Kapitän - so shouldn't we fight for the Neutrality Fleet as a whole?
Ja, Kapitän! Even the Kriegsmarine would be proud that one of its U-Boote destroyed so many Nixen ships.
We would find more Morganas out in the Atlantic than we would with all the patrols around shore we've been doing lately...
I'm glad we're in agreement, Kapitän! I'll let the merchant Kapitäne know the good news.
*GUNFIRE*
More Morganas in the harbor, U-30! We'll have to take care of them first!
@BATTLE
Okay, Kapitän - we have 13 merchant ships that will need our protection to cross over the Atlantic from Europe to the Americas. They're all lined up alongside us and ready to set sail.
I still don't think the Kriegsmarine will like this at all... and 13 is a very unlucky number!
I thought the same thing too, Kapitän - although if we lose one or two, then it won't be an unlucky number anymore...
I seriously hope you're joking...
I am not joking, Kapitän - I am being realistic. The Nixen grow stronger every day, and the journey will be dangerous.
We cannot guarantee anyone's safety, but I have promised the Kapitäne that we will sink every Nixen ship we see.

Fields.MenuText: You're right, U-30. Our main mission is sinking Morganas no matter what.
The Kriegsmarine won't like it, but we'll be on the other side of the Atlantic before HQ notices.
If no one else will protect these merchant ships, we'll have to do our best.

Fields.DialogueText: Spoken like a true savior, Kapitän!
Don't worry, Kapitän - I'm sure we'll sink plenty of Nixen on this patrol!
They won't mind when we tell them how many Nixen we have destroyed, Kapitän. I'm sure you can talk your way out of any trouble.
Where are we taking all of these ships, anyway?
I told the merchant ships that we could escort them to Newfoundland. Once we get there, the convoy will disperse and pick up local escorts to their final destinations.
You already planned all this without running anything by me first?
Well... I knew you would agree, Kapitän! You're our savior, after all!
I'm not anyone's savior, U-30! You might have taken one too many hits to the head in your boxing matches...
*BOOM*
Nixen attacking the convoy, Kapitän!
Ah, hell! Too late to back out now. Let's dive and get some torpedoes in the water!
Jawohl, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
Did we lose any merchant ships?
Nein, Kapitän - not yet.
Those Nixen really caught us off guard there.
Ja, Kapitän. We're not optimized for long range surveillance, unfortunately.

Fields.MenuText: The other ships in our fleet will have to keep watch so we don't get surprised again.
Just one of the many reasons U-boats make bad escorts for convoys...
We'll have to improve our surveillance capabilities the next time we're in port.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course, Kapitän - but we won't see another port until we cross the Atlantic.
The fleet works best when it works as a team, Kapitän. The left hand must jab to probe the opponent's guard so the right hand can find the correct opportunity to strike.
We are still capable of protecting our flock, Kapitän! You are the savior that will bring redemption to U-Boote across the fleet!
Well, those Morganas got the jump on us, but now it's time to finish them off.
Ja, Kapitän! We will strike from the shadows to protect the innocent!
I'm tired of throwing jabs, so let's knock these Morganas out.
Come, Schnuffi! It's time to arm the torpedoes!
@BATTLE
The batteries are almost recharged, Kapitän.
Good. No big rush to get beneath the surface though. It's not like the Morganas can't see all the other ships in our convoy from miles away.
Ja, Kapitän, but these ships are the only way we can move equipment, material, and troops across the ocean.
I wonder if technology will ever find a solution for this. There's got to be a better way of transporting all this war materiel across the Atlantic...
Cargo planes can only do so much, Kapitän. I don't see merchant ships getting replaced any time soon.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe one day cargo airplanes will get big enough to replace ships...
If merchant ships could sail underwater like U-boats, they would be much safer.
Well, as long as the merchant ships need protection, we'll be here.

Fields.DialogueText: Ja, Kapitän! The U-Boot can be a hero on convoy operations after all!
True... but that's a little hard to imagine, Kapitän. Even a U-Boot the size of a whale couldn't carry as much as a typical cargo ship on the surface.
Nein, Kapitän. As long as there are oceans on this Earth, we will need ships to sail them.
Sorry for the rambling thoughts. Whenever we're on the surface, all the fresh air really gets my mind thinking about things.
The extra oxygen up here is always good for the mind - and the body too, Kapitän! Shall we do a little more shadowboxing practice before we have to dive again?
Last time we practiced shadowboxing, you cracked me in the jaw with a solid left hook...
It was an accident, Kapitän! Oh, my past full of mistakes will always haunt me!
*GUNFIRE*
No time to worry about that now - I'm more concerned with all these Morganas haunting us! Return fire, U-30!
Jawohl, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
Everything is going well, Kapitän. It took a bit of adjustment, but now all the ships in the convoy are running at the same speed and keeping proper intervals.
That's good to hear. It's still a long way to go, but it's great that we've managed to get ourselves organized.
Ja, Kapitän. We've fought off all the Nixen so far too - although I'm sure our hardest battles are ahead of us.

Fields.MenuText: You punched a hole in the hull of a Vanity and sunk it to the bottom of the sea. Nothing can stand in our way!
We've got a brave and experienced crew. We can handle any challenge.
It is strange how the battles always seem to get harder the further along we go, isn't it?

Fields.DialogueText: At least it always proves for an exciting climax, Kapitän!
Ja, Kapitän! I'm ready to go the distance!
Ja, Kapitän - and with you as our leader, we'll always have the right solution to win any fight.
I've been talking to the merchant ship kapitän, and some of them might have useful equipment for our boat. Should I ask around to see if we can trade for anything good?
I don't think they're likely to have anything that we... you mean Schnuffi supplies, don't you?
Well... sometimes the meals we have on the boat upset his stomach...
*GUNFIRE*
We've got more important things to worry about than Schnuffi's picky eating habits! Return fire on those Morganas, U-30!
Schnuffi is not picky, Kapitän! He just has higher standards than the average submariner when it comes to eating!
@BATTLE
Good thing we dove right after one of our ships thought they saw a Morgana. Looks like we're coming up on a big fleet of them after all...
Da, Kapitän. Acting quickly has given us the advantage.
We still need to shoot first before they start firing on our merchant ships though.
It's always good to come out swinging - at least when the Nixen are involved.

Fields.MenuText: We can still be aggressive while using our power to protect the innocent.
All the Morganas ever do is attack, so we might as well throw the first punch.
Let's get some torpedoes in the water and give these Morganas a pounding!

Fields.DialogueText: Spoken like a true savior, Kapitän!
Their strategy is always to attack head-on, Kapitän - we will surprise them from below!
Oh! Now that sounds like a good time, Kapitän!
We're almost in range...
Arming torpedoes, Kapitän!
I'll be damned if I'll let those Morganas touch a single ship in our convoy!
Oh, I love it when you speak with such passion, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
Do you think we can sail down to New York once we reach Newfoundland, Kapitän?
Well, I would say we need orders from HQ to do that, but we stopped paying attention to those a while ago...
Why do you want to visit New York?
I want to see Joe Louis.

Fields.MenuText: Joe Louis the heavyweight boxing champion?
He knocked out Max Schmeling a few years ago. The Nazi's didn't like that at all...
You're always shadowboxing, but I didn't know you followed the professional fights too.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course, Kapitän! One must learn by watching the best fighters and seeing how they overcome their opponents.
Nein, Kapitän - it really embarrassed them.
Ja, Kapitän! He's the best in the world!
So I take it you didn't buy into the way the Nazis built Max Schmeling up to be a hero for Germany the first time he beat Joe Louis?
Schmeling is a good fighter too, Kapitän - but Joe Louis won the rematch in a fair fight. Anyone can win in the ring if they train hard and have a good day.
Who wins a third fight then - Schmeling or Louis?
Louis is still fighting - that's why I want to see him in New York. Schmeling won the German and European heavyweight titles - but there are rumors he was drafted into the Luftwaffe.
I guess we won't see Louis and Schmeling fight again until the war is over then.
... Not unless they meet on the battlefield, Kapitän.
*BOOM*
Just another reason to end this war as soon as we can, U-30! Let's get those Morganas!
Jawohl, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
Even if we do sail down to New York, and even if Joe Louis is in town, you won't be able to see him fight.
Why not, Kapitän?
Well, you Belles can't wander too far off the ship, right?
Ja, Kapitän - that is true. But we rarely get a chance to travel all the way to the Americas! This could be my only chance to see Joe Louis in person.

Fields.MenuText: The only way you could see him is if we arranged a fight on the deck of the boat...
I'm pretty sure Joe Louis wouldn't come anywhere near a Nazi U-boat though.
Joe Louis is a busy celebrity. Why would he make time to see a Belle?

Fields.DialogueText: So it is still possible, Kapitän? If anyone could arrange something like this, it would be you.
I wish politics did not get in the way of sport, Kapitän. I just want to see the best boxer in the world.
It would help the war effort by boosting the morale of our crew, Kapitän.
It's not impossible to get Joe Louis to come and visit our boat - but it's not exactly an easy thing to pull of either.
But you are capable of so many amazing things, Kapitän!
I know how to captain a U-boat and defeat the enemy, but those are the limits of my expertise, U-30. I'm a fighter, not a boxing promoter.
Well then... perhaps you don't have to be a promoter, Kapitän. Maybe you can attract Joe Louis by being a fighter instead.
What do you mean?
You can challenge Joe Louis to a fight. Maybe then he'll come to visit the boat so I can see him.
You want me to pick a fight with the heavyweight champion of the world just so you can see him in person?!
You make the idea sound like it's crazy, Kapitän.
He's the heavyweight champion of the world! Are you trying to get me knocked out cold?
*BOOM*
Nein, Kapitän! I have faith in your ability to fight!
Let's take care of these Morganas first, then talk about how crazy you are later!
@BATTLE
The convoy is running well. We've managed to protect all the merchant ships and smash every Morgana fleet we've encountered.
Ja, Kapitän, but we're not even halfway across the Atlantic yet.
That's true - we do need to keep our guard up.
I'm glad my boxing training is starting to get through to you, Kapitän. You'll be good enough to challenge Joe Louis once we get to America.

Fields.MenuText: I'm still not convinced that you can train me up to challenge Joe Louis in such a short time.
I don't want to "challenge" Joe Louis - I want to beat him!
I boxed at the academy, but I'm not a professional. A few days of training won't change that.

Fields.DialogueText: You're already a fighter, Kapitän!
That's the right attitude, Kapitän!
You're not going to win if you go into the fight thinking like that, Kapitän.
We just need to train hard, and you'll be ready to challenge Joe Louis once we reach America. Are you ready for another round on the pads?
Of course... but honestly, getting in the ring with Joe Louis sounds a lot more terrifying than crash diving to torpedo an entire fleet of Morganas.
That's not the right attitude, Kapitän! Now come on - let's work on your combos. Jab, jab, slip, hook, straight...
Jab... jab... slip... hook... straight... Joe Louis is the heavyweight champion of the world, U-30. I don't think I stand a chance against him if I'm just working on these basics...
Of course not, Kapitän - that's why we need to speed up the training so we can move on to the more advanced techniques.
That's not exactly what I was getting at...
*GUNFIRE*
Morganas ahead, U-30!
Crash dive, Kapitän - nothing to be afraid of!
@BATTLE
You're picking things up quickly, Kapitän. I think we're ready to move onto some more advanced boxing moves.
I'm still exhausted from our practice earlier, U-30. I need a little more rest.
Rest?! Kapitän, rest will not be an option if you get in the ring with Joe Louis!
You're getting ahead of yourself, U-30. There's no guarantee that Joe Louis will show up if I challenge him to a fight.
Not if you're fighting like a low-ranked amateur, Kapitän! The better you are, the more likely Joe Louis will think you're a competitor worthy of fighting.

Fields.MenuText: I know you really want to see Joe Louis, but I think you're losing focus on our convoy mission.
We've already got a life or death challenge on our hands escorting these merchant ships across the Atlantic.
Would Joe Louis really fight an unheard of opponent like me?

Fields.DialogueText: Hasn't everyone heard of you already, Kapitän? You're the savior who will help the world defeat the Nixen.
We're not having any trouble sinking the Nixen, Kapitän. I'm more worried about you dropping your guard in the ring.
Our flock will always be safe under your protection, Kapitän. Now we just need to improve your skills in the ring.
I'm trying my best to improve my boxing, but we don't have much time. You know, we could always have you challenge Joe Louis instead...
Don't be ridiculous, Kapitän - Joe Louis would never fight a Walküre! Salt Lake City has already asked! Plus, I'd knock him right out in one punch...
I guess his fight against Max Schmeling was already political enough. It wouldn't do the Neutrality Fleet any good to have a Nazi U-boat knocking out America's hero.
Nein, Kapitän - the politicians would only use the results for their propaganda purposes.
However, if you fight, no one even has to know that you're a navy Kapitän. You can pose as just another challenger for his heavyweight title.
Just another bum of the month for him to knock out? Why am I doing this again?
I just have to see Joe Louis fight at least once, Kapitän! He's the heavyweight champion of the world. There's no better boxer on Earth than him!
That's what I'm afraid of...
*BOOM*
Nixen attacking, Kapitän! Time for the counterpunch!
@BATTLE
U-30. Do I *look* like a heavyweight to you?
A little bit of harmless subterfuge will see you through! I've given it a great deal of thought.
Why am I doing this again?
We're running low on torpedoes and food. Can you radio the merchant ships in the convoy to coordinate a resupply?
Ja, Kapitän.
We're about halfway across the Atlantic. I don't want to count our chickens before they're hatched, but we haven't lost a single merchent ship yet.
I'm not so worried about the Nixen, Kapitän, but--
Can we take a break from the boxing and Joe Louis talk for a bit? My shoulders are killing me with all the training we're doing...
Hmm... getting enough rest is part of training too. Perhaps I've been pushing you too hard, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: I haven't had to do this much physical training since my academy days.
You've been getting a little rougher during our sparring sessions...
I like it when you push me to my limits.

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't know you were that sort of type, Kapitän. You might like it, but I must be careful to avoid breaking you.
Even Kapitäne have to stay in shape so they can keep up with the rest of the crew.
Joe Louis won't go any easier on you, Kapitän. You need to be ready for anything he can throw at you.
Taking the rest of the day off from training won't set us back too much, but my body will thank me.
Ja, Kapitän, let's give you a bit more rest.
Why don't you give Schnuffi a few laps around the deck? He could use a little training too...
I'm afraid he does not have the stamina for anything too strenuous, Kapitän.
*GUNFIRE*
Nixen! Let's return fire, Kapitän!
I don't need any rest when it comes to fighting Morganas! Hit them with everything we've got!
@BATTLE
What's the story behind Schnuffi, anyway?
What do you mean, Kapitän?
Well, it's a little unusual to have a dog on a U-boat. How did you and Schnuffi end up together?
Schnuffi is... a stray, Kapitän. I found him at sea.

Fields.MenuText: You found a stray dog at sea?
This will require a little more explanation...
So Schnuffi was swimming around the ocean?!

Fields.DialogueText: Ja, Kapitän. Why does that seem so strange?
Ja, Kapitän - there are stray dogs everywhere these days. It's quite sad, isn't it?
What do you mean, Kapitän? Schnuffi is such a cute dog and he needed help. What else needs to be explained?
Dogs don't swim, U-30.
What? Of course dogs swim, Kapitän. That's why we call it the "Hundepaddel."
That's not what I meant. Of course dogs can swim, but not in the sense that a fish or a whale or a shark swims. Dogs aren't swimming around in the middle of the ocean.
If you must know, Kapitän, I found Schnuffi shortly after I awoke for the first time. There was a passenger ship sinking close by, and Schnuffi was in need of rescue.
Oh, well that was good of you! What a strange coincidence that you awoke right when there were civilians in need of rescue. Did you help anyone else?
Äh... nein, Kapitän. Unfortunately we did not encounter any others in need of rescue...
Wait a second, you didn't have anything to do with the sinking of that passenger ship, did you?
Ähhm... you certainly are a curious one, aren't you, Kapitän?
*BOOM*
Oh, those Nixen certainly have the worst timing, don't they? Gefechtsstationen, Kapitän!
Why do I feel like you're hiding something?
Hiding is in the nature of every U-boot, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
So you pulled Schnuffi out of the water after his ship sank?
Ja, Kapitän. Just in time too - Schnuffi isn't the strongest swimmer.
He must have been pretty traumatized by the whole experience. That might explain why he's a little... strange.
What is strange about Schnuffi, Kapitän?

Fields.MenuText: He's very shy and doesn't seem to like people.
He's hardly got any stamina and barely moves.
He's always got such a weird look in his eyes...

Fields.DialogueText: Is that strange? I feel like I can relate to him, Kapitän. We both like to stay out of the spotlight.
Schnuffi is more about mental strength than physical strength, Kapitän.
Schnuffi has been through a lot, Kapitän.
Well, you certainly are kind to take care of him. I'm not sure he would survive very long on his own.
Certainly not if he was still trying to swim around in the ocean...
He doesn't really get in the way, so I don't mind having him on board. I would say he's a good morale boost for the other sailors, but he really just hides from people most of the time.
He is a U-boot mascot, Kapitän - being a little strange and staying in the shadows is our standard operating procedure.
True, but a U-boat does know how to strike aggressively when the situation calls for it. I don't see Schnuffi doing that anytime soon.
Schnuffi can strike fiercely when necessary, Kapitän. I'm sure he will prove his worth one day when he has the right opportunity.
*BOOM*
Ha! Schnuffi dove behind those pipes the moment he heard a loud noise! We've got Morganas ahead - and luckily the rest of the crew is already moving to battle stations.
Don't be afraid, Schnuffi! These Nixen don't stand a chance against us!
@BATTLE
You need to be a little less predictable, Kapitän.
What do you mean?
You're throwing the same combos with the same timing. It's easy for the other fighter to pick up on that and counter you.

Fields.MenuText: So I need to change up my rhythm a bit?
Do I need to learn new combos?
How do I avoid being countered?

Fields.DialogueText: Hunt with your jab. Try to find the right opportunity to throw a combo that will work, Kapitän.
Nein, Kapitän. A good one-two is all you need... but you must land them correctly when there is an opening.
Ja, Kapitän. Your rhythm now is like a waltz when you need it to be more unpredictable like jazz.
I feel like the only way I can learn how to do that is to just get more experience fighting in the ring... and we don't have much more time before we get to America.
Hmm... you're right, Kapitän. You just gave me an idea.
I don't have a good feeling about this...
You need a warm up fight before you challenge Joe Louis.
A warm up fight? Where are we going to find another boxer for me to take on in the middle of the Atlantic?
I can find someone on one of the merchant ships we're escorting. That way you won't have to fight anyone on the crew.
I would say that's a great idea - I don't want to fight anyone on the crew - but I'd rather not fight a civilian sailor we're escorting either.
You'll have to fight someone to get ready for Joe Louis, Kapitän. Don't worry - I'll find someone who's good, but still bad enough to build your confidence.
You're going to find a bad boxer for me to fight? That doesn't boost my confidence at all!
*GUNFIRE*
Let's sink some Nixen, Kapitän - that always boosts your confidence!
We've got plenty of experience in the ring against those Morganas. Prepare to dive!
@BATTLE
I found a good opponent for your warm up fight, Kapitän.
That was fast. You were able to find a boxer on one of the merchant ships we're escorting?
Ja, well... he's not exactly a trained boxer... but remember this fight is all about getting you warmed up and building your confidence.
So who am I fighting exactly?
He's a cook on one of the merchant freighters. He's not exactly the fastest or most conditioned athlete, but he did agree to the fight.
So you're going to have me fight an out of shape cook to get me ready to take on Joe Louis?
He's the best challenger I could find for your on such short notice, Kapitän. It's actually quite remarkable considering we're in the middle of the Atlantic.

Fields.MenuText: Well, fighting a fat cook doesn't sound too scary...

Fields.DialogueText: Ja! Kapitän - you are already building your confidence!

Fields.MenuText: If I can't take care of this guy, I've got no chance against Joe Louis.
How heavy is he? I'm worried about a weight advantage.

Fields.DialogueText: You can't start worrying about things like that before the fight, Kapitän! The point is to build your confidence.
Don't worry, Kapitän - I'm sure you'll knock this cook right out! That is why I chose such an amateur opponent, after all.
When is this fight happening then? I need to get ready.
Tomorrow right here on our deck, Kapitän. We needed to hurry things along since we'll be in America soon.
Tomorrow! That's not much time...
You're already ready, Kapitän - don't worry! Let's concentrate on knocking out these Nixen ahead of us first.
Sounds good to me! Let's get  'em, Schnuffi!
@BATTLE
That's the freighter coming alongside, Kapitän. Your opponent is the cook on that ship.
All right - I'm as ready as I'll ever be.
Remember, the point of this fight is for you to practice your basics and get comfortable in the ring.
Right. I just need to focus on footwork, rhythm, and timing.
Ja, Kapitän. Keep it simple, and focus on creating openings.
Oh, here comes the team from the merchant ship. I assume that big guy is the one I'm fighting?
Ja - he's big but the last time he boxed was years ago in grade school. You've been training hard and have improved a lot since we started. He'll be an easy opponent for you, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: I'll floor him with a solid left hook in the first round.
I'll keep him moving and punching - he'll be winded by round three.
Might have to go the distance - I'm not sure I have the power to knock him out.

Fields.DialogueText: That's the confidence I want to see, Kapitän! You are our savior, after all!
That's using your head, Kapitän! Such clever tactics - no wonder you're our savior!
You're our Kapitän and savior - of course you have enough power to knock him out!
I'm glad I've got you in my corner, U-30.
There's no fight we can't win if we work together, Kapitän - although this cook is rather large, now that I can see him up close...
I thought you were trying to boost my confidence with this fight, U-30!
It's okay to be confident, Kapitän - just make sure you get out of the way if he starts throwing punches with power...
I'll keep that in mind. I do have a ship and crew to take care of, so getting knocked out would be pretty inconvenient.
Speaking of inconvenient, we've got Nixen ahead.
I'm already warmed up for a fight, so let's knock out these Morganas before I knock out this cook.
@BATTLE
That was a good first round, Kapitän!
Good? I hit him with a few stiff jabs, but he got me with that haymaker out of nowhere!
You still remained on your feet though. It's good to know you can take a punch like that and keep fighting.
Isn't the point of boxing to hit the other guy more than he hits you?
You are doing that, Kapitän - he just caught you off-guard with that straight. Remember to keep moving - and keep your guard up.

Fields.MenuText: Right. I can wear him down if he keeps swinging big like that.
My jabs are connecting, but they aren't doing anything to him.
This guy is hardly Joe Louis, and I'm struggling to hurt him!

Fields.DialogueText: Ja, Kapitän. His size is not always an advantage.
Once you hit him with a good jab, follow up with a combo, Kapitän. A nice hook or straight can still knock him off his feet.
Just stick to our plan, Kapitän. Keep your mind on this fight, and we'll worry about Joe Louis later.
Right! I can take him out if I just use my head.
Ja, Kapitän! Time for round two, so get back out there!
I'll give 'em hell, U-30!
*GUNFIRE*
Morganas!
No need to stop the fight, Kapitän! I'll make sure the crew handles these Morganas!
@BATTLE
Wow, that was a hell of a fight!
It was close, but I knew our savior would come out on top!
I could feel him slowing down by round three, so setting up that hook by round five was easy. He fell right over, and I know right away he wasn't getting up.
You stuck to the basics and kept a cool head the whole time, Kapitän. You were like a surgeon in the ring, slowly dissecting your opponent.
Well, he put up a good fight and landed a couple of big ones on me too. I have a feeling I'm going to wake up really sore tomorrow.
We'll be in America tomorrow. We can see if Joe Louis has any response to that letter I sent.
Wait - what letter?
Oh, before we left port with the convoy, I sent a letter in your name to Joe Louis. I challenged him to a fight. I hope you don't mind.
You did what?! You wrote Joe Louis a letter addressed from me without even asking me first? Why didn't you mention this earlier?
You wouldn't have approved until you felt confident to take him on, but I knew we would have enough time to train you up during the crossing. I've always had faith in you.

Fields.MenuText: Ha! That was pretty clever of you. I'm definitely ready to take on Joe Louis after all our training.
I can't believe you did that. I would reprimand you, but I can't do much to a Belle.
Do you really think I'm ready to take on Joe Louis?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course you're ready, Kapitän. You  always had the fighting spirit and tactical mindset. We just needed to practice applying it all in the ring.
I did it with the best of intentions, Kapitän. Now you're a much better boxer, and maybe we'll also get to meet Joe Louis.
You're our savior, Kapitän. No one can stand in your way to victory.
What did you say in the letter anyway? Joe Louis is probably pretty busy, so he's not going to fight just anyone who writes him.
I did think about that too, Kapitän. I wrote that the fight would help boost the morale of the entire Neutrality Fleet.
Joe Louis and Max Schmeling were used for manipulative propaganda before, but this fight could be different. Imagine a Neutrality Fleet Kapitän fighting the Heavyweight Champion of the World.
Don't you think the fight would inspire so many others to sign up and serve alongside such a strong and brave savior like you?
Well, maybe... that's assuming Joe Louis doesn't knock me out in one punch.
You should be more confident than that, Kapitän - we've done so much training together.
Morganas on the horizon - I'm confident we can blow them right out of the water!
@BATTLE
Is that land, Kapitän?
I believe so, U-30! We've managed to escort a convoy clear across the Atlantic without any loses.
I knew you could do it, Kapitän! U-Boot Kapitän, savior and guardian of merchant convoys, and professional boxer - you can do everything!
I'm not officially a professional boxer since I haven't earned any money fighting. I'm not a savior either, but I'm not sure what the official requirement is for that.
You saved me, Kapitän - and you'll save the rest of us from these horrible Nixen.
Sometimes I forget that my main job is being a boat captain. We've been doing so much boxing, that's all I can think about these days.
Don't worry about the boat, Kapitän - you've already trained the crew well enough to take on any Nixen. Now all you need to do is focus on fighting Joe Louis.

Fields.MenuText: We still don't even know if he'll take the fight.
Trust me - I'm more than ready to knock Joe Louis to the canvas.
I have serious responsibilities to this boat and crew - not to mention the war effort!

Fields.DialogueText: It would be a tremendous boost to the war effort against the Nixen. It would be disappointing if he turned down the fight with you.
You can do it, Kapitän! You threw some great punches in your last fight, and all the training has made you more dangerous than ever.
If you fight Joe Louis, think of how many others you will inspire to join the war against the Nixen. Your impact will be felt far beyond the deck of this U-boot.
Well, the merchant ships are starting to head off in their own directions now. I'm proud to say we brought them across the Atlantic safely.
We escorted them like a good shepherd, Kapitän. Hmm... Schnuffi is a stray, but do you think he might have some Deutscher Schäferhund in him?
I... seriously doubt that.
I'm not sure - he has a certain spark that reminds me of a loyal and aggressive Deutscher Schäferhund...
I think Schnuffi's a mutt until he proves otherwise. Looks like there are a few Morganas at the mouth of the harbor, so let's take care of them so our merchant ships can get to the dock safely.
Jawohl, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
Schnuffi is so happy to see dry land again!
I'm sure - the poor guy's had a lot of past drama out at sea.
So we'll sail down the New York next. It's been a long voyage, but we're almost there.
I hope you're not too tired from the journey, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: With all the physical training I've been doing, I rarely get tired these days.
I'm exhausted from all the boxing. I can't wait to check into a nice hotel in New York and get some rest.
It doesn't matter how tired I am - a ships' captain always gets the job done.

Fields.DialogueText: You have put on a lot of muscle with all this training, Kapitän. It's done wonders for your physique!
Well, I hope you're not too tired, Kapitän - we still have work to do.
I hope you have enough energy when we finally get to New York...
I forgot to mention that in the letter I wrote to Joe Louis, I told him to meet us at dock the moment we arrive. We'll host the fight on the deck of our boat.
Are you kidding me? So no rest at all? Straight from fighting Morganas acros the Atlantic to fighting Joe Louis without even setting foot on dry ground?
I thought it would make for a better show that way - since the objective is to promote the war effort after all.
For someone who likes to avoid the spotlight, you sure don't mind shoving me into it!
You're our savior, Kapitän - you need to get comfortable with speaking to your flock.
The only person I'm going to be thinking about saving is myself if I end up in the ring with Joe Louis. If we're all done with the resupply, let's get on our way to New York.
Jawohl, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
I can't believe Joe Louis actually showed up for the fight...
Ja, Kapitän! Isn't it wonderful? There must be hundreds - maybe even thousands - of people in the crowd. This is a perfect opportunity for you to preach the gospel.
I'm not even thinking about preaching the gospel - Joe Louis is on the other side of that ring, and he doesn't look like he's here to make friends!
Just remember your - keep your feet moving, your guard up... find your range with the jab, good head movement, find your rhythm but stay unpredictable, find his rhythm and counter it--

Fields.MenuText: You lost me after "keep your feet moving"...
It's a lot to remember, but it's just muscle memory after all that training.
Joe Louis doesn't stand a chance against these fists!

Fields.DialogueText: Focus, Kapitän! If your head is not in this fight, you're going to wake up in the hospital!
Ja, Kapitän - stay relaxed and you'll do just fine.
Don't be too overconfident, Kapitän. You're a good fighter, but that's still Joe Louis over there. One good punch from him and the fight is over.
I still don't understand why you wanted to see Joe Louis so badly, and why I of all people had to fight him.
He's the best boxer there is, Kapitän. Of course I can't fight him, because I'm much stronger than him, but I still have a lot to learn from his technique.
Since I trained you to fight like I fight, this is the closest I can get to fighting Joe Louis myself. Watching the fight will be quite educational. He's simply a master of his craft.
So are you cheering for him or me?
Mmm...
Mmm?! What does that mean?!
*DING*
Round one, Kapitän! Keep your hands up!
*GUNFIRE*
Just a few Nixen in the harbor, Kapitän. The crew and I can handle it - keep fighting until you hear the bell!
@BATTLE
I'm impressed you made it through the first round, Kapitän. Joe Louis has had more than a few first round knockouts...
You sounded a lot more confident in me before, U-30.
I'm still confident in you, Kapitän! I just appreciate all the technical skill that's on display here. Even Schnuffi seems to be worked up about the fight!
Schnuffi won't stop barking once the bell sounds - it's the most I've heard out of him since I took command of the boat.
Schnuffi is very protective of everyone on the crew, including you, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: Well, let that little mutt know that I can protect myself in the ring.
I suppose it's good that he has guard instincts - even if he doesn't have the muscle to back it up.
The barking is really distracting. I can't hear myself think out there in the ring.

Fields.DialogueText: You shouldn't be thinking, Kapitän - it should all be reflex by this point.
No need to be rude to Schnuffi, Kapitän! He's your biggest fan.
Don't underestimate him, Kapitän. He can strike with aggression when needed!
Just make sure Schnuffi stays out of the way. The last thing I need is to have a crazy dog yapping and running wild while I'm fighting for my life in there!
Don't worry about Schnuffi - just keep your head in the fight!
Every punch from Joe Louis is like an artillery shell landing on the deck! I'm not sure I can go the distance here...
*DING*
Round two, Kapitän! Work the jab and find an opening!
*GUNFIRE*
The Nixen are back again? Keep fighting Joe, Kapitän - we'll take care of the Nixen!
At least the crowd is loving it - they get a boxing match and a fireworks show! You keep this boat from sinking, and I'll keep Joe from knocking me out!
@BATTLE
I'm not sure I can make it through round three, U-30!
Stop shouting at me, Kapitän! You need to keep your eyes on Louis! He's going to hit you if you keep looking over here--
*THWACK*
Kapitän! Try to stay on your feet--
Oof...
*THUD*
*BARK*
Schnuffi! I know the Kapitän is down, but you can't run into the ring--
*BARK*
*GUNFIRE*
Scheisse! More Nixen!
@BATTLE
What do you mean? I didn't lose? My head is killing me - how long was I out?
About ten minutes, Kapitän. You'll be fine. I'm actually more worried about Joe Louis.
Huh? Joe Louis is the one who knocked me out.
Ja... but after you fell, Joe Louis turned around and faced the crowd to celebrate - that's when Schnuffi ran into the ring and jumped on Joe Louis's back...
It was... difficult to watch. Luckily his team said the closest hospital is nearby. The judges declared the fight a "no contest."

Fields.MenuText: Well... at least you got to see Joe Louis fight.
I'm surprised Schnuffi had it in him. I've got a little more respect for the mutt now.
If I had one more round, I could have knocked out Joe Louis myself...

Fields.DialogueText: Ja, Kapitän! It was amazing seeing both of you fight. I learned a lot by watching.
Schnuffi is very protective, Kapitän. I know you look down on him sometimes, but we're the only family he has.
Hmm... perhaps you're still a little woozy from getting knocked out yourself, Kapitän. We'll have time to go over the match later.
Well, now what, U-30? You saw your hero fight, so is it back to the war now?
Correction - I saw both of my heroes fight, Kapitän!
I'm happy you got what you wanted. I appreciate the training too, but I think I'm more cut out for being a boat captain than a heavyweight boxer.
Maybe, Kapitän, but you did teach me a few new moves in your two fights. I'm looking forward to trying out your techniques against the Nixen.
You know, you're a real knockout, U-30. Anyway, if you ever find yourself in trouble, you can always count on Schnuffi to maul a Morgana or two.
Ja, Kapitän, and I know I can always count on you - my savior.
I really wish you'd stop calling me that. Now help me get these gloves off. I need to get cleaned up so I can head over to the hospital to apologize to Joe Louis.
Jawohl, Kapitän!
*BARK*
